title: ID Quantum
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724121149im_/http:/typophile.com/files/correct_nuka_cola_quantum_label_by_rycekaeks-d6gbnfe_6637.png)

trying to find this font for a while now, anybody think they can help me out?
author: Jimoptera

comments.content:
Did you go through the fonts of this type at Dafont?  
 [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303&text=Quan+Tum](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724121149/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303&text=Quan+Tum "http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303&text=Quan+Tum")  
 [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=304&text=Quan+Tum](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724121149/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=304&text=Quan+Tum "http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=304&text=Quan+Tum")  
 [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=301&text=Quan+Tum](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724121149/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=301&text=Quan+Tum "http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=301&text=Quan+Tum")  
Don
Yes, but I didn't have much luck. I'll have a look through those links though.
That is very, very close Fivos, once again a good find.

Good find Fivos. In the ball park and could be used as a substitute. Most people would not notice the difference. There are an incredible number of fan fonts that are variations on these sci-fi themes.  
Don
That'll work just fine, nice find! =D
